text: The Megakaryocyte / Platelet - specific enhancer of the alpha2beta1 integrin gene : two tandem AP1 sites and the mitogen - activated protein kinase signaling cascade .
The alpha2beta1 integrin , a collagen receptor on platelets and megakaryocytes , is required for normal platelet function .

Transcriptional regulation of the <extra_id_0> alpha2 integrin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene in cells undergoing megakaryocytic differentiation requires a core promoter between bp -30 and -92 , a silencer between bp -92 and -351 , and megakaryocytic enhancers in the distal 5 ' flank .

text: We have now identified a 229-bp region of the distal 5 ' flank of the <extra_id_0> alpha2 integrin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene required for high-level enhancer activity in cells with megakaryocytic features .

Two tandem AP1 binding sites with dyad symmetry are required for enhancer activity and for DNA - protein complex formation with members of the <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> family .

text: Inhibition of the MAP kinase cascade with PD98059 , a specific inhibitor of <extra_id_0> MAPK kinase 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , prevented the expression of the <extra_id_0> alpha2 integrin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit in cells induced to become megakaryocytic .

text: We provide a model of megakaryocytic differentiation in which expression of the <extra_id_0> alpha2 integrin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene requires signaling via the MAP kinase pathway to activate two tandem AP1 binding sites in the <extra_id_0> alpha2 integrin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> enhancer .
